instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2532: What is 820-2532? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
Hi,
board clean without liquid, probably wifi cable cause problem. don't boot but green light.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12,5V
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>=10ohm
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>=10
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>=10
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>=10
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>=3,4V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3,4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_REG</SIGNAL>=0V is it normal? if not <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> dead?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message: Voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>? If something like 0.3V then replace <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>. Also make sure to use a REAL 85W charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
i have on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>=0,37V, i replace it and now i have 1,105, but no boot again.
sorry i use now a real 85W for the measure.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message: Did you short the power on pads? No auto power on. To eliminate a fake charger connect a battery and let it charge for a while.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2532</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No boot
threads.message:
Ok it's ok for me, she is alive :D. sorry i forgot to post the result.
thanks
